text: what exactly takes place when a market is suspended in terms of bets being matched? Is there the potential to cancel bets upon the market reopening if you expect the odds you placed at to no longer be favourable -  for instance backing a team that are now 1 nill down? Or a way to minimise losses that can occur from a market suspension? Thanks

elements.text: what exactly takes place when a market is suspended in terms of bets being matched? Is there the potential to cancel bets upon the market reopening if you expect the odds you placed at to no longer be favourable -  for instance backing a team that are now 1 nill down? Or a way to minimise losses that can occur from a market suspension? Thanks

text: Unless you place bets with the persist flag, your unmatched bets will cancel automatically on a suspension.

elements.text: Unless you place bets with the persist flag, your unmatched bets will cancel automatically on a suspension.

text: So if that is a worry for you, maybe don't do that.

elements.text: So if that is a worry for you, maybe don't do that.

text:
In Australian greyhounds 9 and 10 are reserve dogs. 

The sorting should be in trap order so 9 and 10 will go in place of the scratched dog.

elements.text: In Australian greyhounds 9 and 10 are reserve dogs.
The sorting should be in trap order so 9 and 10 will go in place of the scratched dog.

text: so to clarify if i place a bet on an in play football match with the the "LAPSE" flag does that mean once the market is suspended (normally due to a goal) the unmatched amount  of the bet will be cancelled?

elements.text: so to clarify if i place a bet on an in play football match with the the "LAPSE" flag does that mean once the market is suspended (normally due to a goal) the unmatched amount  of the bet will be cancelled?

text: yes but not all suspensions, only what betfair call a 'material change' (goal scored, red card, runner removal, turn in-play etc.)

elements.text: yes but not all suspensions, only what betfair call a 'material change' (goal scored, red card, runner removal, turn in-play etc.)

text: Betfair could do with updating their docs on PersistenceType to reflect this. Currently LAPSE just has this "Lapse the order when the market is turned in-play" but you need persist flag set even in horses to stay live into a stewards enquiry / photo finish.

elements.text: Betfair could do with updating their docs on PersistenceType to reflect this. Currently LAPSE just has this "Lapse the order when the market is turned in-play" but you need persist flag set even in horses to stay live into a stewards enquiry / photo finish.

text: I should probably get over this fee thing, but I'm steaming extra today because i'm trying to update my pnl calculator which uses the "exchange betting history" tab to correctly handle the fees, and of course it requires hacky conditional statements, since, you know, all their reports call " XXX / to - score " the name of a market. So my old code that calculated fees on profitable markets id wrong, because ya know, the reports like everyone else would consider the to score market as one market, not a collection of them.

elements.text: I should probably get over this fee thing, but I'm steaming extra today because i'm trying to update my pnl calculator which uses the "exchange betting history" tab to correctly handle the fees, and of course it requires hacky conditional statements, since, you know, all their reports call " XXX / to - score " the name of a market. So my old code that calculated fees on profitable markets id wrong, because ya know, the reports like everyone else would consider the to score market as one market, not a collection of them.

text: Hi all, I was using flumine for AU horse racings, and was trying to differentiate thorough bred and pace/trot races (by checking if "pace" or "trot" appears in the race name). When backtesting with the PRO data, you can see race name (e.g. 'Redc (AUS) 1st Apr') from _market_book.market_definition.name_, but when in live/stream API, this name is a None. Guess I am missing something. Please could anyone point me to the right place in flumine to check this race name? Thanks!

elements.text: Hi all, I was using flumine for AU horse racings, and was trying to differentiate thorough bred and pace/trot races (by checking if "pace" or "trot" appears in the race name). When backtesting with the PRO data, you can see race name (e.g. 'Redc (AUS) 1st Apr') from
market_book.market_definition.name
, but when in live/stream API, this name is a None. Guess I am missing something. Please could anyone point me to the right place in flumine to check this race name? Thanks!

text: Add EX_MARKET_DEF to the streaming filter

elements.text: Add EX_MARKET_DEF to the streaming filter

text: Thanks <@UUCD6P13J>. I am using the default value for _market_data_filter_ in the BaseStrategy class, so EX_MARKET_DEF is added. I added it anyway when init my strategy class, but the the name is still a None.  Do I miss anything?

elements.text: Thanks
. I am using the default value for
market_data_filter
in the BaseStrategy class, so EX_MARKET_DEF is added. I added it anyway when init my strategy class, but the the name is still a None.  Do I miss anything?
